label_fr: L'outil de suivi pour la stratégie des données
desc_en: Government of Canada data implementation strategy results.
desc_fr: Résultats de la stratégie de mise en œuvre des données du gouvernement du Canada.
about_message_en:
Introducing the [2023–2026 Data Strategy for the Federal Public Service - Canada.ca](https://www.canada.ca/en/treasury-board-secretariat/corporate/reports/2023-2026-data-strategy.html) tracker. The tracker highlights progress on the actions identified in the Federal Data Strategy.
The 2023-2026 Federal Data Strategy is a renewal of the 2018 Data Strategy Roadmap for the Federal Public Service. It builds on existing progress and work across the public service and is organized around four mission areas:

- Proactively considering data by design in all stages of government initiatives
- Effectively stewarding data for decision-making
- Improving user experience and maintaining trust by enabling data-driven services through data that flows securely where it is needed
- Empowering the public service with the talent and tools it needs

The tracker reports on the identified actions within each of these four missions. The actions also drive digital transformation in the Government of Canada, as they align with [Canada’s Digital Ambition 2022](https://canada-preview.adobecqms.net/en/government/system/digital-government/government-canada-digital-operations-strategic-plans/canada-digital-ambition.html) and build on the [Policy on Service and Digital](https://www.tbs-sct.canada.ca/pol/doc-eng.aspx?id=32603).
Over the next three years they will move the public service closer to realizing our overarching goals of building a public service that effectively harnesses data as a valuable asset for informed decision-making and enhancing citizen-centered service delivery.
about_message_fr: Résultats de la stratégie de mise en œuvre des données du gouvernement du Canada.
